It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu

This adds a poor layer of security on top of an RPC layer that we already recommend to _not_ be exposed to the public Internet.  Even seemingly harmless RPC commands might stress the wallet and delay other RPCs commands, hold important locks, etc.

If you want to do this, the best suggestion is to create a proxy on top of bitcoind, much like a pool server (which is nothing but an HTTP proxy).

@jgarzik Thanks for the suggestion. If core devs don't want the patch, no problem. I am curious where this recommendation is to not expose RPC layer. I don't see it on the wiki jsonrpc pages, here or here. Can you provide me a pointer? thank
Closing. I updated the JSON-RPC wiki page with a warning about exposing the RPC port.\n
